page.title: 03ISLE OF PURBECK GOLF CLUB
page.content: The club lies to the West of Studland village on the North slope of Dean Hill running down onto Godlingston Heath. The club was founded in 1890.The course is 6280 yards in length and covers an area of about 300 acres.The membership exceeds 700,all but 100 of whom are local people.The club employs 6 ground-staff.Many folk play Winter and Summer although older people are more loyal during the cold weather! Some people join the club for social contact rather than for the sport. The clubhouse is very attractive and boasts a wall set with fossils and Dinosaur footprints from the local Purbeck Quarries.Visitors are welcome and there is no membership waiting list at present.(June 1985)
